document_title: Corneal ulcers: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_name: viem-loet-giac-mac.json_8_Should eye drops be used when suffering from corneal ulcers?
subsection_content:
The use of eye drops for ulcerative keratitis requires clearly identifying the cause. If the cause is infection, the doctor will prescribe eye drops such as antibiotic, antifungal, antiviral eye drops and possibly anti-inflammatory eye drops.
Patients need to absolutely follow the doctor's instructions to use the right dose, at the right time, and in the right combination to achieve high treatment effectiveness and avoid complications.
The Eye Clinic at Tam Anh General Hospital System is equipped with modern machinery and equipment and a team of highly qualified doctors and nurses that will help protect your eyes and prevent eye diseases.
